bill_title: clarify the application of the special assessment procedure used for inundated farmland.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to clarify the application of the special assessment procedure used for inundated farmland. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-6-33.21 be amended to read as follows: 10-6-33.21. If an application is submitted pursuant to § 10-6-33.22, the director of equalization shall take into consideration and make adjustments in setting the assessed value for agricultural land which has been inundated by floods and is was not farmable during the past three growing seasons. The director of equalization shall use the marshland soils rating classification pursuant to § 10-6-33.2 and 10-6-33.7 to determine the assessed value of the acreage inundated and not farmable. The director of equalization shall also use the marshland soils rating classification for land enrolled in a federal or state program removing such land from production, if the land has been inundated by floods and was not farmable during the past three growing seasons. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
